place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Very nostalgic eating here. It was nice to take my family here. Went for lunch, was busy but we didn t wait for very long. Food came out quickly & was very hot and fresh. Service was great & the atmosphere brought me back

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: This Bobs Big Boy was a surprise. The portions were large, the food good and the service was amazing. Best waitress I have had in years. Almost everything included a salad plus fries or fruit for a reasonable price. The iced tea was fresh brewed, just the way it should be. I wish I had taken pictures of the Chocolate shakes,a work of art. They even have a classic car night to bring back that feeling of stepping back in time. An American classic at its best.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I was really craving country fried steak so I looked it up and found Bobs Big Boy, which it turned out was on my fiances to go list. We were happy 1st time customers! All the food was well prepared, flavorful, and very filling. Staff was friendly and checked on us multiple times. There was plenty of free parking available in their lot. The only disappointment - there wasnt any more Strawberry pie left sooooo we just have to come back again!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: We were seated fairly quickly even though they were busy. The food was very good and the staff was excellent. I will diffently be back.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: This place is cool. No two ways about it. Lots to see, lots of food options, lots of history. We sat in the Beatles booth and, as luck would have it, only had to wait about ten minutes... although the poor booth could do with some refurbishing. My food (patraimi burger) was regretfully meh, but wife and son were thrilled with theirs. The chocolate cake and ice cream stack desert was scrumptious. But know what really made this five stars over all? Our server, Steven. Such an awesome guy. Never made us feel rushed, easy banter and good suggestions. If all servers were like him, restaurants would be amazing. After sampling all three mixed soda options Id rank vanilla at the top, then cherry and chocolate. However, had I not over indulged in these, I wouldve asked for a 50/50 mix of cherry and chocolate... mixed a little I had left over and it was damn good!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Burbank s Bob s Big Boy has good old fashion nostalgic atmosphere! The folks who work there provide good service. And, they are a happy, caring team members that creates good vibes. People don t congregate at Bob s, in mass, for the gourmet food! It s the nostalgia, atmosphere, great service, AND all American food, Double Decker Burgers, which I grew up enjoying from the early 60 s. Enjoy the attached pictures. Bon appetit!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: If youre a fan of Heat, the legendary crime movie from 1995 with Robert De Niro and Al Pacino, then youre in for a treat at Bobs Big Boy in Burbank. This place not only serves up tasty food but also holds the esteemed title of being a minor filming location for that cinematic masterpiece. Talk about dining with a side of Hollywood glamour! As soon as you step inside, you can feel the weight of history and the nostalgia of countless memories. Its like being in a living museum, but with delicious smells wafting through the air. Bobs double deck burger, the original big boy burger. This towering creation is a monument to all things burger-related. With each juicy bite, you can taste the history and craftsmanship that goes into this masterpiece. Its a burger that would make even the most seasoned foodie weak at the knees. And lets not forget about the hot fudge cake a dessert that will make your taste buds do a happy dance. Its like a sweet symphony of chocolatey goodness, topped with a dollop of nostalgia. One bite of this heavenly treat, and youll be transported back to your childhood, where life was simple, and dessert was the highlight of any meal. The attendant was not only kind but also made you feel like a VIP. They provided top-notch service with a smile, which only added to the overall delightful experience. Its a journey through time that will leave you with a satisfied belly and a heart full of happy memories. Just be prepared to become a regular because once you experience the magic, youll keep coming back for more.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Although the drunken table across from us made it very Uncomfortable our Server Linda was Awesome and very attentive, Sweet, and Funny. Helped make our experience from a 4 to a 10.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: One of the great food brands I grew up with and had to visit being back in California for only a short time. The staff were professional and attentive and the vibe reminded me great memories of my dad and some of my uncles. We had some burgers and had to get some souvenirs such as some shirts, coffee mugs and the kid in me almost got the skateboard deck.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: This place is great.  Good vibes,  old school diner. Friday is classic car night. Extra fun. Kid-friendliness: Old school diner atmosphere.  Friendly staff. Wheelchair accessibility: Easy access

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Ive been coming here my whole life.  Bobs Big Boy holds so many great memories of my life. Ive eaten here with so many special people in my life. Coming here is a regular part of my life. The food is good classic diner  food . My usual is their chili on top of spaghetti with cheese.   Or  chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and their wonderful garlic bread.  Dessert is a must   . The hot fudge cake is amazing. If you havent tried Bobs Big Boy definitely do

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Been some time since my prior visit, but love that its open late.  The chicken was cooked incredibly.  I was beyond impressed with the food and service.  Tons of free parking in the lot.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The original Bobs Big Boy! We make the pilgramage each time we visit L.A. It never disappoints!! Have their delicious milkshakes, any flavor. Big enough for 2 to share. Very friendly and helpful...when the host noticed my husband walking wobbly on his cane (recent knee surgery) he quickly directed us to the nearest booth rather than walk us to the table they originally had for us.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The Double Decker Hot Fudge Cake was an all-time dessert for myself and my cousin. I have tears in my eyes just thinking about how delightful it was to eat  . Burger was great, great service, great staff... I can feel the history here and can truly appreciate it. Will definitely come back here

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Had the Waffles,eggs with cheddar, bacon and sausage links. So yummy! Coming back for some hot fudge cake, havent had it in years.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Very nostalgic place. Burgers were filling and tasty. Kitschy atmosphere. Sorta reminded me of the old Woolworths restaurants from back in the day. If you know you how!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: A fun, clean place with amazing service and great food. Special thanks to Drew Carey for supporting the writers during the WGA strike.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Its Bobs, you always know what youre going to get. The food and restaurants are legendary if you grew up in So Cal. The Toluca Lake location is old but so clean and well taken care of. Its a throwback to a much simpler time. Always a great place to grab lunch!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Fun experience visiting a protected historic landmark that is still in business. House-made biscuit were super delicious as well as the cheese omelette. Special thanks to our waiter, Armen, for his pleasantness and service!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bobs Big Boy is a diner legend. Also, this particular location is an iconic site among the annals of Hollywood lore and legend. Like any great diner, get breakfast or a burger with fries. They are also craft savvy in the department of desserts. If you are in a rush, no worries. You can order takeout as well. On the way out, be sure to snag some nifty BBB gear to commemorate your travels there. Parking: There is a parking lot for this establishment, but they do have security on the premises to make sure you are parked there to actually eat at the facility on hand. Keep that in mind.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bobs Big boy never fails. Loved it since I was a kid. My kids love it too. A must try.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Its been too many years since Ive been. Nostalgic, good food, good service, photo op (with Bobs Big Boy) and souvenirs. Definitely, make it a point to visit.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: My family and I go here about once every month or so and the service is always good to great depending on the server. Today we sat outside and had great service. I usually get the Super Big Boy with avocado and bacon but today I ordered the California Strawberry and Chicken Salad. It was delicious and left me wanting to figure out how to make it at home. After finishing our lunch we all shared a Hot Fudge Cake which is a must if you have room after your meal. Kid-friendliness: My kids love coming here for the fun atmosphere and they always enjoy coloring their Big Boy menus while we wait for our food.
response_from_owner_text: Always a joy getting to welcome you and your family for a Super Big Boy with avocado and bacon, Randy, though were glad that you loved the California Strawberry Chicken Salad this time! Whenever youre craving your usual or something new, know that we would love to welcome you back again. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bob s big boy offers great food selection and reasonably priced. No waiting lines and super friendly customer service. We would definitely be back since our kids loved the milkshakes. The lady s room is small but fully stocked.
response_from_owner_text: Theres really no better way to enjoy a warm California evening with the kiddos like sipping on a few hand-spun milkshakes, Ana! Looking forward to welcoming you and the family back again soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Extremely fun vibes and good service. I had the bacon cheeseburger, and my wife had the Burbank beef dip. We shared a banana shake. Portions are MASSIVE and everything tasted very good, if not great. Will definitely be back!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The atmosphere is incredible and the playlist they pick is always perfect. The staff is kind and accommodating. Great place! Definitely recommend if you want to be transported into the 50s. The place is pretty clean and the booths are spacious and comfortable. I definitely recommend going here for a milkshake or a dessert. The rest of the menu is okay and fairly priced. Parking: I always find a spot in the free parking lot right outside the diner.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: We first visited this location while on vacation in October 2020. It was great but we didnt get the full experience since it was outdoor seating only due to covid. We were just back for five days and ate dinner here 10/2 and lunch on 10/5 before we headed home. We all had the Big Boy combo both times and everything was delicious. Service is great and the atmosphere is among the best of any restaurant. We hope to visit again before too long. Parking: The parking lot is big and you shouldnt have a hard time finding a spot.
response_from_owner_text: Were glad you enjoyed visiting us, Kristen! We hope to see you again whenever youre around. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bobs Big Boy is such a nice relaxing and classic diner. Really its just a good place to feel nostalgic through different stages of your life. Bring your kids, bring your grand parents and just vibe.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: OMG the shakes were the bomb!!! Best OG burger Ive had in a long time.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I hadnt been to Bobs in years. So I was visiting a friend in Glendale and we decided to go to Bobs. It was a pleasant experience, friendly staff, good food and a delightful waitress. The food was good and served up fast. So if you are feeling like a Big Boy or breakfast or anything in between you know Bobs is the place to be. I had a delicious chicken fried steak here and the service is amazing.
response_from_owner_text: So glad you could come back for another good meal, Francis! Hoping to see you back in the future for more Big Boy breakfasts. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bobs Big Boy: a very nice old style diner. We went in for a milkshake. Ordered it, got it and drank it. It tasted like a good milkshake should. The friendly staff and the atmosphere made it compleet. I would definitely recommend a visit!
response_from_owner_text: Happy to have been able to welcome you by for a classic milkshake, Kristof! Looking forward to having you back for another one sometime soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Nice nostalgia trip. First time Ive been at a Bobs Big Boy since the last one in my home town closed back in the late 80s.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Havent had Bobs since I was a kid. Bobs big boy was one of my grandpa favorite places, but we unfortunately dont have any near us. Walking up to the doors I was already flooded with memories. Sitting in one of those booths again, looking at that iconic hamburger kid, I felt like my papa could walk around the corner any second. I know he was enjoying me sharing his favorite with my youngest. 30 plus years later, food still tastes just as amazing as I remember. Service is outstanding. Staffing, all around, are top notch. From the time I walked in the door until the second I left, there was nothing but perfection from every employee.
response_from_owner_text: It may have been quite some time since we last got to see each other, Nicole, but were glad that your visit to Bobs was just as incredible as it was when you were a kid! We cant wait to welcome you back again sometime soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Wonderful service every time we go. Fantastic fried chicken. Such as tasty bacon bleu cheese burger. Great milkshakes and prices. We love it here very much!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Great family dining, good food and very efficient and attentive staff. This place is very busy on the weekends but my group of 4 was seated quickly and our food arrived in a timely manner as well. I don t know how they do it? I guess it s because they ve been in business so long. More travel and food on Instagram Follow @Northern_maverick

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Cozy and tasty classic diner. I got the blue cheese burger which was quite good. I should have added bacon which would have been better. Great spot for an old time diner experience. The staff was kind and patient even though it was super busy.
response_from_owner_text: Theres really nothing better than a blue cheese cheeseburger, Andrew! Hope we can welcome you back for another (with bacon this time!) sometime soon. See you around! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Visiting from Ohio and had to see where all the different Big Boy franchises across the country started. It was a great visit and cool to see how slightly different the west coast Big Boy is from the east!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bobs Big Boy in Burbank is a classic diner that exudes nostalgic charm and serves up delicious comfort food. From the moment you step through the doors, youre transported to a bygone era, surrounded by vintage decor and the comforting aroma of well-prepared dishes. The menu at Bobs Big Boy offers a range of satisfying options, from their iconic Big Boy burger to their mouthwatering milkshakes and crispy onion rings. The flavors are rich, the portions generous, and the food consistently hits the spot when youre craving classic American fare. While the overall dining experience at Bobs Big Boy Burbank is enjoyable, one area that could benefit from improvement is the consistency of service. While some visits have been met with friendly and attentive staff, there have been occasions where the service has fallen short of expectations. Its important for a restaurant to provide consistent and reliable service to ensure that every guest has a positive experience. The staff should strive to be attentive, accommodating, and knowledgeable about the menu. Consistency in service can greatly enhance the overall dining experience and leave guests feeling satisfied and well taken care of. That being said, when the service is on point, it adds to the overall enjoyment of the meal. The staff at their best are friendly, welcoming, and prompt, making you feel like a valued guest and providing a pleasant dining experience. Despite the occasional inconsistency in service, the charm and nostalgia of Bobs Big Boy Burbank, along with its delicious comfort food, make it a popular choice among locals and visitors alike. The classic diner atmosphere, tasty menu offerings, and iconic Big Boy burger create a unique dining experience that is hard to replicate. While Bobs Big Boy Burbank delivers on taste and atmosphere, the service could benefit from more consistency. By focusing on providing reliable and attentive service, the restaurant can ensure that every guest has an outstanding dining experience to match the quality of their comforting and satisfying dishes.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: What can I say about Bob s? Just the thought of Bob s conjures up so many memories. It takes me back to different stages of my life, eating with family or friends over the years. I have to say that I am kind of upset after my visit to Bob s Big Boy. Don t get me wrong, I didn t have bad food or bad service. The reason I am upset is that I don t know why it took me soooooo long to try the fried chicken at Bob s. The crunch off each and every bite was unreal. I also went for a side of biscuits and gravy. I have to say that the gravy is also an amazing dip for French fries! I think next time I go I will ask for my fries to be covered in it. My wife had the fish and chips and she loved them. The fish was flavorful and crunchy and the fries were perfect, especially dipped in the tartar sauce. I am now and will always be a long time Bob s Big Boy fan.
response_from_owner_text: Such a shame that you only just now got to try our fried chicken, Robert -- sounds like youll just have to make up for lost time and lost chances to eat that crunchy goodness! Heres hoping we can welcome you and your wife back for another excellent meal sometime soon. Well have a table waiting for you! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: TL;DR -  if you are a local you already know it is good.  If you are a tourist make this one of your meals. Ful review - What an amazing place.  Storied history, a literal landmark in LA and Hollywood.  Quick service, delicious food and best of all prices that were the opposite of their plus sized mascot. I had the guacamole and bacon chicken sandwich.  The chicken was moist, the bacon was crisp, but still had some chew to it and the lettuce and tomato were fresh.  The fries were good, but not outstanding.  If I had been paying tourist trap prices I might have complained, but instead our family of four was able to enjoy a nice meal for under $60 with tip.  That was including a milkshake!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Staple food joint. Historical and great food with great prices.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I am from this area but have been away for many years.  The food and atmosphere was amazing.  Took me back to my childhood.  The chili spaghetti and French fries with mom fussing at me to eat my food not just the fries!!  Thank you for the trip down memory lane and the food as remembered.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Great food, lovely historic atmosphere and very clean restaurant

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: As soon as you walk in you are greeted by the hostess who quickly sits you. Not long after the waiter comes gets your order for some drinks and seconds after that you re ready to place your food order. With plenty of room to sit atmosphere is great staff is friendly. Your right across The Garry Marshall Theatre. For today I went with bobs classic Burger which is always a winner buns lightly Toasted on the grill, patties are the bomb fries are lightly seasoned crispy and taste great never soggy. Whatever you decide to choose it s all good, your gonna like it no you re gonna love it. And if you re lucky you ll get Juan as your waiter as for all the waiters and waitresses tip them good cause I did for a great great meal. By the way Thank you Bobs Big Boy for reminding me what it was to be me an relax.
response_from_owner_text: We all need to unwind with a great burger sometimes, Alex, so were glad that we could welcome you by for a moment to just be you. Whenever you need a break again, wed be happy to see you back again! See you around. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: This was a great blast from the past. I have so many great memories of going to Bobs with my grandparents. Its nice to see that a couple have survived. The interior, with all the orange vinyl, makes you feel like youre back in the 60s. The familiar taste of the famous Big Boy Burger did not disappoint. The salad was fresh with great ranch dressing. The fries were cooked perfectly. We even added on some of their amazing onion rings. Im glad they had takeout boxes as there was no way we could finish it all. It was the first time I took my daughter and I hope for many more opportunities to take her there. Parking: It was a slight wait to find a parking space in their large parking lot. Just shows how many others love Bobs too.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I had one of the best waffles of my life here. My husband had some kind of dip sandwich. That also looked delicious. He wouldn t even give me a bite, but to be fair I wouldn t give him a bite of my waffle either. I had a chocolate Coke, which was exactly what it sounds like. We also went on Friday because my husband has a huge fan of classic cars. He s an artist and we spent a few hours sitting around plein air, painting the different classic cars. We had a really nice time, everyone was very friendly.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I had their fried chicken and it was one of the best fried chickens I ever had. My son got the Big Boy burger and my wife got the fish and chips which were both equally as good.
response_from_owner_text: Proud to have served up some of the best fried chicken youve ever had, Rainier! Hope to welcome you back for more sometime soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Great nostalgia place for lunch on a weekend. Pappy Parkers Fried Chicken w/ corn & mash. Fun fact - The movie Heat was filmed here and Beatles had lunch here.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your review of our location, Mike! Cant wait to welcome you back to enjoy a little movie magic and some fried chicken soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I ordered the Big Boy burger which was delicious. I wasnt prepared for the amount of food it was as I got a drink and fries too. I did not finish it. Took another day but I did finish it and enjoyed every bite. Wheelchair accessibility: Very accessible. No problems whatsoever.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The legendary diner Bob s Big Boy and in my opinion it lived up to its reputation. Be prepared to potentially wait because this place is popular! Great food and hopefully not too overworked staff!

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Never had a bad meal at Bobs. Friendly servers, nice atmosphere. I always recommend to go there. My family used to go to the drive-in that was in Glendale, CA. It had the car hop service.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bobs big boy is always good! It had been a family favorite since my mom was in High school.  I dont live locally anymore so every time I come home we have to go! Highly recommend and its the best burger youll ever have!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for sharing your love for our place, Tara! Whenever you make it back to our area, we would love to welcome you again. See you soon! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I hadnt been to a Bobs Big Boy in 39 years. I loved going to Bobs when I was young. The food at this last Bobs is still just as good now as it was then. It brought back a lot of memories. Service is great, food is great. You cant go wrong at Bobs.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The photos on the walls and history of big boys was fun to read about. Customer service was amazing attendant was really kind definitely leaving a tip. The food was delicious definitely coming back with my girlfriend
response_from_owner_text: Justin, were thrilled you enjoyed your visit the other day! Come back again soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Just like I fondly remember, so good! Ordered the original, Big Boy Combo w/thousand island on my salad and a coke. My Mother used to take us kids after church, if we were good in church....lol...cool memory, love that they have kept the decor original. Sadly they closed both locations in Fresno many years ago... Parking: The security/parking attendant was so friendly and very accomodating.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: First time eating here, and It lived to the hype.  Food was great.  Service was great.  Highly recommend.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The moment I took my first bite, I was overwhelmed with flashbacks of eating here when I was a kid in the 80s. I had a souvenir plastic Bobs Big Boy piggy bank that they used to sell in the restaurant. Good times!
response_from_owner_text: Were glad you had a great visit, Andres! Wed love to see you back again. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: NOSTALGIA ... ok, grew up in California, and I remember bobs big boy... so I had to check it out. The big boy out front seemed much taller as a child ... lol. It looks like an old diner on the inside, several displays showing old toys etc. A real trip down memory lane. All that being said, what I didnt remember, was the food. But it was probably the best burger   I had my entire trip! It was filling and tasted great! Parking: Lots of space when I was there. Parked in an area that looked like old drive up/drive in area.
response_from_owner_text: Were glad that we could welcome you by to enjoy a little nostalgia, Victor! Happy to have had you by again for one of the best burgers youve had. See you back for another one the next time you make it out this way! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: A great historical diner, with excellent, cheerful service, fast cooks, a great menu, clean interior, ample parking and a great vibe. This one is the oldest remaining Bobs Big Boy in the world, really one of about two remaining from a giant chain that invented many aspects of the modern American hamburger, including that middle bun you might see in a golden arches item... Of course, a Big Boy burger is an appropriate thing to try, but do not miss their pastrami. And their pastrami cheeseburger is another piece of SoCal history, and a good example of the genre.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking the time to care about our history, Erik! It really means so much to us. Heres hoping we can see you back for another pastrami cheeseburger in the future! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: The double deck burger (original big boy burger) is a must. The melt tasted great. Decent portions and price.
response_from_owner_text: Theres truly nothing better than an excellent double-decker burger, Abdulaziz! Hope to welcome you back for another one sometime soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Literally one of my favorite resturaunts of all time. Food is always good, servers are always awesome and nice, service is always quick and amazing. Recommend this place for any time, any meal, any where. Its really that great.
response_from_owner_text: Were really happy you enjoyed your visit, Ajs! Hoping youll be back again soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: A great place to eat.   You will need a mask to enter here.  Great service and staff.   Food was delicious.   It was crowded but, there are plenty of seats.  The bathrooms were very clean.  And, there is plenty of parking.   I highly recommend stopping here for a bite to eat.   Great place to eat with friends or family.
response_from_owner_text: It was lovely having you join us for a bite the other day! Glad to hear our tasty food and great service impressed. Whether youre back with friends or family, we welcome you back again soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Had to wait for a seat for over an hour. It was worth the wait.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Great to have been back to one of the most nostalgic restaurants I have enjoyed  for many many years. Glad BB is still around, cant wait to go back soon!
response_from_owner_text: Happy to welcome you by for a wonderful, nostalgic meal, Janel! Looking forward to having you back again soon, too! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: This is always our first stop on our way to shows at the Hollywood Bowl. I love being surrounded by the history of the restaurant and the area. The food is always amazing, and there are plenty of choices.

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: We sat at the counter. We were greeted by Tina. She had a hair tie, it was very retro and perfect for this establishment. Her smile was genuine and sweet. She was prompt, professional and you felt like you were welcomed there. A rarity these days. One of my biggest pet peeves is feeling like I m bothering you, as well as being called guys (I hate that). I luv the vibe here and the food is hot and fresh. We usually go for the Friday night car show. We even bought a hat.
response_from_owner_text: Well be sure to let Tina know that her service was reminiscent of that old-school friendliness, Shauna! We know shell appreciate your sentiment. Heres hoping we can welcome you back for another Friday night car show sometime soon. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: What a great place to remind you of what a great, fun, fast diner used to be. The food actually got better, plate sizes bigger, and the price was almost the same as 20 years ago . From the Open Face Turkey Sandwhich (  awesome) to the salad with Bobs signature BlueCheese dressing(  awesome) to the HotFudge Cake with vanilla ice cream stuffed in the middle and a cherry    on top. (   second to none) They dont make em like Bobs anymore. FANTASTIC

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Bob s Big Boy in Burbank has been one of my favorite places to eat since I was a kid. My visit today was amazing and just as good as my last visit 10 years ago. If you ve never been, you must stop by for an original big boy combo and one of their delicious desserts.
response_from_owner_text: Proud to have been a favorite of yours since you were a kid, Sean! Well always be here to serve up a meal thats just as good as you remember whenever you want to come back by to see us again. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: This place was great! First time coming here and it was super busy but we were taken care of quickly. The food was great and the portions were large !

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Miss Bob!  We had a great time, the Bobs Big Boy Hamburger   with the relish was amazing, and so was the Cobb Salad!  What great memories and yummy food.  Dont be on a diet LOL

place_name: Bob's Big Boy

review_text: 2022.01-09/SUN.0945: Yays! Janelle was working today! When is she not?!! We love her! We saw her and waved and she was able to sit us in her section! Always such a pleasure seeing her happy face to start our day! All the servers at Bobs has ALWAYS been awesome no matter who you get! They run the operation like In and Out. Superb customer service and their quality of food, portions and pricing is always good. We originally headed to Sweet Butter on Ventura but opted for friendly smiles and table service. We decided to go all out today and have something out of the ordinary. We had the The Big Three and a Belgian Waflle with two eggs and sausage. Our Big Three came with three eggs, three flapjacks and three links of sausage. We ordered extra sausage on the side because their links are delicous! We already had pork belly last night so we werent feeling bacon today. Our Belgium Waffle combo came with two eggs and sausage. I had Janelle bring me fresh strawberries and butter for my waffle because Im not fond of syrup at all. We had such a great breakfast and a great start to our day knowing that we were able to be graced by Janelle. Shes the best! She always kept our drinks filled and just being around her was very calming. Its very busy at Bobs but when you have a chance to enjoy the good company and want great service, you can at Bobs. 2019: Love this place! No matter what time of day we visit, the service is excellent! We were greeted by a huge smile from Esther! She has the best sense of humor ever and is the sweetest. We didnt have to wait long at all. It was quick and the host was also friendly when he sat us. It was MLK Jr. Day so it was busy with many large parties. We had one of the best servers there, Kebra. She always had a smile and took really good care of us even though her section was quickly being filled by a couple of four tops and a large 15 top party.  She rocked and always remained serene and calm. We had the fried chicken entree and the 8 oz. Sirloin steak. With our entrees we chose a nice side salad, steamed vegetables and mash potatoes. His fried chicken came with white gravy. I didnt want gravy and Im so glad. Those were the creamiest, rich mash potatoes Ive ever had. I would definitely go there just for a side of them. The fried chicken was juicy, lightly crispy and well seasoned. My steak was cooked to perfection - rare. I was surprised that my steak was cooked so well. There was clear fluid running out of it yet it was seared, juicy and deliciously rare! This place never fails. Everyones attitudes are wonderful here and make our experience memorable. As we left, again we encountered lovely Esther who wished is a nice evening. Whatever they are doing here must be the same practices as In and Out because they never disappoint, provide exceptional customer service and the food preparation and quality is consistent. Kudos to the chefs and staff - no wonder its constantly the best 24/7!!!!
response_from_owner_text: This review means so much to us, Mortimer! Were all about preserving the simple joys of good, home cooking. Glad you loved our fried chicken and steak plates. Well definitely share your compliments with Esther -- we hope to see you again soon! Best, Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Ummmm drove from San Francisco to LA because I wanted to go to a diner. But which diner, there are many options in Los Angeles. But which one to choose? The key criteria are ambiance, deals, clientele, decor and food. 1. Ambience: Bobs big boy s ambiance is 10/10 everyone in California needs to see this. 2. Deals: Were talking deals. Pretty solid value for money. It s hard because there are other diners that also great value for money but can t complain, pretty good value for money. Not the best deal I ve ever had but not the worst deal. 3. Clientele: there were a lot of people at bbb at 11 o clock at night but we didn t have to wait long for a table. Other patrons also seemed to appreciate deals and milkshakes as many people ordered milkshakes. Unlike some diners I ve been to I didn t fear too much for my personal safety but I was a little intimidated but the BIG BOI holding the hamburger outside. 4: decor: speaking big boys, there some big big boys and smaller big boys (aka medium boys) displayed. Lots of diners draw inspiration from this classic decor. One comment when. Used the bathroom the gaps when I was using te toilet were so wide I could see in-n-out. Lastly 5: food: food was good, milkshake was great five stars.
response_from_owner_text: Love that we could hit all five or your criteria for a great late-night meal, Kim! Whenever you want to enjoy another classic burger, we would be more than happy to welcome you back. -Mike Lopez, General Manager

review_text: Bobs Big Boy is such an iconic place. The food is just as good now as when I remembered going with my family as a kid. Whether its late night eats or all-day breakfast, lunch or dinner you cant go wrong. Our son loved his french toast breakfast and our daughter said her burger was one of the best shes ever had. Of course you can never go wrong with a salad and their delicious blue cheese dressing. Yum! And what meal is complete with out a cherry coke. Food and staff are always wonderful but the food tasted especially good at 2:30 on the morning after a long day! Worth the trip to stop buy and grab a bite to eat. If not Im the area, make sure you take some time to stop by Bobs!
response_from_owner_text: Theres really no better feeling than finding a place where everyone  in the family can find something to love, Brandi! Well be sure to continue serving up the same high quality to you and your family as long as our doors are open. See you all again soon! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: Quick overview: - 10-minute wait for a booth, seated quickly. - ADORABLE decor, lots of photo-ops, incredible bits of history all over the restaurant. - the food was amazing. - prices are incredibly reasonable. Food & beverage details: Onion rings for the appetizer hot, crispy and *not* over-breaded! All my food came out hot, my fiance s fries were cold but they sent him a fresh hot plate right away, took less than 2 min to get the new hot plate of fries. If you ask for crispy fries they will do it right! Burgers were hot and delicious, we got the classic big boy combo and they came out fast. It was so delicious, I m pretty sure I inhaled it rather than chewed. I still can t believe I ve lived in the area for over 2 years and am just now having Bob s Big Boy for the first time. We will be back!!!
response_from_owner_text: So glad that you had such a fun time eating a few onion rings, taking photos of our decor, and savoring the history of our place, Rin! Hope to welcome you by for our classic car show on Fridays sometime soon! -Mike Lopez, General Manager

place_name: Bob's Big Boy
review_text: I absolutely love Bobs Big Boy. Its my favorite place to go when visiting Cali. Their famous Bobs Big Boy Burger is so delicious! There really isnt anything on the menu that I dont like! Thank you for keeping BBB my most favorite piece of nostalgia that always serves great food! Vegetarian options: Salads are what I recall. Im not vegetarian,  so I dont look for those options on the menu. Dietary restrictions: There is something in the menu for everyone. You may also ask for your meal to be prepared with less salt,  no mayo,  etc... Parking: The only time it may be a challenge finding parking in the lot is during car hop night.  Otherwise,  there is valet and street parking available. Kid-friendliness: Its just a cool place! Lots to see that would be interesting to kids. Wheelchair accessibility: Yes,  there are no steps getting in or out of Bobs.  The restaurant is easy to get thru.  The only tight squeeze may be getting in and out of the restroom.

review_text: Had a great time taking my significant other there for his birthday! So glad and happy to have a nice steak house in Mckinney!

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: Wow!!  Came here to check out the cigar lounge and was very impressed!! The service was very good. The lounge is intimate, and the ambiance is well executed. I had a great time conversing with Martin and Allison (bartender and cigar lounge manager). Theyre both top notch people. Only complaint would be to add another starch or two as a side.

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: Excellent! Where to begin with Bob s  I ve been to many upscale and high end restaurants around the world, and Bob s is top notch. The staff are fantastic. They were welcoming and helpful from the moment we walked in until we left. Our waitress was terrific. The ribeye steak was amazing and so was the filet mignon. The carrots, smashed potatoes and brocollini were great and so was the creme brulee. I was also impressed and thankful they ask about allergies and were accommodating. The restaurant is elegant and classy, and I was glad to see them enforce the dress code to even the wealthiest folks who ignored it. If I had any cons it would be that it was loud, and the tables were kind of close. However, this isn t unusual for restaurants during dinner. Overall it was a great experience and we ll be back.

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: Great classy and chill atmosphere. Very beautiful inside, a bit hidden from the road.  I think this is my new favorite Bob s though. Love the bread and butter, it s the best in town   I enjoyed the Caesar salad, im new to seafood and very picky and just didn t care for my crab cakes as the sauce was more on the sweet side, but im sure my husband will like them as leftovers. The kids shared a 16oz filet, it was delicious and well seasoned. They even sliced it into thin strips to make it easier for them. We tried some new to us things from Bobs tonight, My husband got the barratta salad and the shrimp cocktail.  Between the two, I think he really enjoyed the shrimp cocktail.

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: Food was great, server Jenny was very nice. Kept up with drinks as they started to go down or been sitting too long. Kept cleaning up around the table.

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: I cant boast enough about this place!  5 stars doesnt even do it justice.  Of all the restaurants we have been to in the DFW area, this is by far the best of the best!!! From the valet, to the greeting inside - everything about this vibe was classy! Our waiter was Dimitri and he was phenomenal!  Hands down the best waiter we have had anywhere. Food was spectacular! Wagu was to die for - and this carrot cake - superb and so huge (had to take a picture) Definitely recommend for a special occasion or just because!  Highly rating this place :)

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: Raquel was our server and she did an absolutely amazing job taking care of us. As far as the food, what can you say ??? Incredible !!!!!!! I m very thankful they opened close to our house.

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: We went to Bobs tonight in McKinney for the first time. We have been going to the Plano location for years. We made a reservation and were promptly seated in a booth. We were greeted by Jim, Right off the bat, he was great. He was friendly, professional, and funny. Everything came out quickly and correct.  We have requested Jim from now on when we will visit Bobs McKinney and we will be back very very soon! Thank you, Bobs.

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: This is probably the best restaurant I have ever been to. Service is amazing, food is off the charts, drinks made well, and their cigar lounge is classy and well stocked. Every time I visit, Im made to feel welcome, and treated like a king. Dan, Jeanette, and Martin sure know how to run a place! I cant reccomend this place enough. Bobs is a great restaurant, but this one should be their flagship. 100 stars!!!

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney

Great time and will come back again.

I love the atmosphere in Dallas and Plano.  The atmosphere in McKinney plain (No art work) and loud.  Love them all and the McKinney location was a fun change.

review_text: Bobs was a 10/10 experience, I loved all the family traditions!! It was my very first time there with my friends, we were a party of 5. review_text: Amazing place! Shawn the manager greeted us and helped us out since it was our first time. He was very kind and incredible. My favorites were the scallops, lamb chops, and the roasted neuske bacon slices!!! The Cote De Boeuf melted in your mouth! If Im being honest, we kind of ordered a bit of everything to try out. All in all, will definitely be coming back

place_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House Craig Ranch/McKinney
review_text: Ive been a Bobs fan for years and have dined at many locations in and out of Texas. I was very excited to have this new restaurant in McKinney as its close to my home. My wife and I dined at the bar. The menu is slightly different and seemed a bit pricier than other locations. Not a show stopper, but just an observation. As other reviews state the bartenders are friendly and attentive. Food was on point although a bit slow on arrival. There were no chef specials that evening, growing pains I expect. The entrance hallway is very enticing, but the bar and dining areas seemed a bit off, perhaps a bit too bright. I will probably wait a while for a return visit.

reviewer_name: John L Dawson, Ed.D., Real Estate Broker
review_text: The food and service was great. We had a party of 6 and we could not hear across the table. You had to concentrate on what the person next to you was saying. It was way too loud. It was nice to go outside where it was quieter. We ate from 6:00 to 8:00 PM. It was fun, but very loud! I checked the decibel level and it was 79-94 decibels. The appetizer of fried onion rings was more than ample for our 6. There were 12 of them. The Fried shrimp was awesome. Caesar Salad was very tasty. Filet Mignonette was really good. We did not try desserts as we were full, but they were huge. We saw cake and Icecream. The room was square so sound was amplified. We will give them another try. The price was comparable to other upscale restaurants. 6 Shrimp, a big carrot, massed potatoes and salad was $40. Steak was $50, $60, or $70 for 6, 12, and 16 oz respective. Give them a try!

review_text: This Bobs just isnt up to the standards of the other Bobs in the area. Might take some time since it is fairly new. Had a Tomahawk last night and it was well done on one side and rare on the other. I have had many Tomahawks at both the Plano and Grapevine locations and they are always perfectly cooked at medium rare. The onion rings we normally love were also not as fresh and crispy. Overall not terrible, but disappointing for a Bobs.
